required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 12-month, Randomized, Efficacy and Safety Study of 0.5 mg Ranibizumab vs Laser in Chinese Diabetic Macular Edema (DME) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A 12-month, Randomized, Double-masked, Multicenter, Laser-controlled Phase III Study Assessing the Efficacy and Safety of 0.5 mg Ranibizumab Dosed PRN in Subjects With Visual Impairment Due to Diabetic Macular Edema in Chinese Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Study of efficacy and safety of 0.5 mg ranibizumab in Chinese patients with diabetic macular edema (DME)

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study was to provide efficacy and safety data on 0.5 mg ranibizumab intravitreal injections compared to laser photocoagulation in Chinese patients with visual impairment due to DME. Treatment was driven by achieving vision stabilization.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Average Change From Baseline in Best-Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) (Letters) to Month 1 Through 12
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Monthly from Month 1 through Month 12
primary_outcome.description: Visual acuity with eyeglasses was assessed in a sitting position using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at an initial testing distance of 4 meters. A letter score was calculated based on the number of letters correctly identified at the specified distance. Twelve monthly BCVA values were averaged [(Month1+Month2+...+Month12)/12], and the baseline BCVA value was subtracted from the average. A positive change value indicates an improvement in visual acuity, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in BCVA (Letters) at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Monthly from Month 1 through Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Visual acuity with eyeglasses was assessed in a sitting position using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at an initial testing distance of 4 meters. A letter score was calculated based on the number of letters correctly identified at the specified distance. A positive change value indicates an improvement in visual acuity, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Central Sub-Field Thickness (CSFT) at Each Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Monthly from Month 1 through Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: CSFT (the average retinal thickness of the circular area within 1 millimeter diameter around the foveal center) was assessed using Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT). A negative change value indicates an improvement in macular edema, while a positive change value indicates a worsening. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With BCVA Gain of ≥ 10 and ≥ 15 Letters From Baseline at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Visual acuity with eyeglasses was assessed in a sitting position using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at an initial testing distance of 4 meters. A letter score was calculated based on the number of letters correctly identified at the specified distance. A positive change value indicates an improvement in visual acuity, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With BCVA Loss of < 10 and < 15 Letters From Baseline to Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Visual acuity with eyeglasses was assessed in a sitting position using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at an initial testing distance of 4 meters. A letter score was calculated based on the number of letters correctly identified at the specified distance. A positive change value indicates an improvement in visual acuity, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With BCVA ≥ 73 Letters at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Visual acuity with eyeglasses was assessed in a sitting position using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at an initial testing distance of 4 meters. A letter score was calculated based on the number of letters correctly identified at the specified distance. A positive change value indicates an improvement in visual acuity, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. BCVA ≥ 73 letters is approximately equivalent to 20/40 on a Snellen chart. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Average Change in BCVA From Month 4 to Month 12 Compared to Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Visual acuity with eyeglasses was assessed in a sitting position using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at an initial testing distance of 4 meters. A letter score was calculated based on the number of letters correctly identified at the specified distance. Nine monthly BCVA values were averaged [(Month4+Month5+...+Month12)/9],and the Month 3 BCVA value was subtracted from the average. A positive change value indicates an improvement in visual acuity, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Visual Functioning at Month 6 and Month 12, Composite Score
secondary_outcome.description: Visual functioning was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in visual functioning, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported General Health at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: General health was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in general health, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported General Vision at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: General vision was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in general vision, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Color Vision at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Color vision was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in color vision, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Peripheral Vision at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral vision was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in peripheral vision, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Ocular Pain at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Ocular pain was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in ocular pain, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Near Activities at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Near activities were assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in near activities, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Distance Activities at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Distance activities were assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in distance activities, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Social Functioning at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Social functioning was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in social functioning, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Mental Health at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Mental health was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in mental health, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Roles Difficulties at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Roles difficulties were assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in roles difficulties, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Dependency at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Dependency was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in dependency, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Driving at Month 6 and Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Driving was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in driving, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. Note: Many patients did not answer the driving related question as they did not drive at all.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Ranibizumab Re-treatments Received in the Study Eye From Month 3 Onward
secondary_outcome.description: A ranibizumab re-treatment was defined as an administration of ranibizumab injection at a scheduled visit following at least one non-missed visit where ranibizumab was not administered in the study eye due to visual acuity stabilization. This outcome measure was pre-specified for the Ranibizumab 0.5 mg arm only.

arm_group.description: 3 initial intravitreal injections to the study eye at Day 1, Month 1 and Month 2, followed by as-needed intravitreal injections of ranibizumab 0.5 mg guided by VA stabilization, plus sham laser
Laser photocoagulation applied to the study eye at Day 1, followed by active laser photocoagulation at intervals no shorter than 3 months apart, plus sham injections

intervention.description: Ranibizumab 0.5 mg/0.05 mL for intravitreal injection
Laser photocoagulation according to Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) guidelines
Imitation of an intravitreal injection consisting of an empty vial and an injection syringe without a needle

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female Chinese patients ≥ 18 years of age with diabetes mellitus and with HbA1c ≤10.0%
- Stable medication for diabetes within 3 months prior to Visit 1
- Visual impairment due to DME with BCVA score between 78 and 39 letters as measured by ETDRS-like charts at 4 meters
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Stroke or myocardial infarction less than 3 months prior to screening visit
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- Active ocular infection or intraocular inflammation in any eye
- Treatment with any anti-angiogenic drugs within 3 months prior to baseline visit in any eye
- Active proliferative diabetic retinopathy in study eye
- Use of other investigational drugs within 30 days and systemic anti-VEGF drugs within 6 months prior to baseline visit
- Prior laser photocoagulation or intraocular procedure within 3 months prior to baseline in study eye
- History of intravitreal corticosteroid treatment in phakic study eye, and in aphakic or pseudophakic within 3 months prior to screening

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: After eligibility confirmation, patients were randomized in a 4:1 ratio to 2 treatment arms.

group.title: Ranibizumab (RFB002)
group.description: 3 initial intravitreal injections to the study eye at Day 1, Month 1 and Month 2, followed by as-needed intravitreal injections of ranibizumab 0.5 mg guided by VA stabilization, plus sham laser

group.title: Laser
group.description: Laser photocoagulation applied to the study eye at Day 1, followed by active laser photocoagulation at intervals no shorter than 3 months apart, plus sham injections

group.description: Laser photocoagulation applied to the study eye at Day 1, followed by active laser photocoagulation at intervals no shorter than 3 months apart, plus sham injections

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Best Corrected Visual Acuity
measure.description: Visual acuity with eyeglasses was assessed in a sitting position using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at an initial testing distance of 4 meters. A letter score was calculated based on the number of letters correctly identified at the specified distance. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

outcome.title: Mean Average Change From Baseline in Best-Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) (Letters) to Month 1 Through 12
outcome.description: Visual acuity with eyeglasses was assessed in a sitting position using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at an initial testing distance of 4 meters. A letter score was calculated based on the number of letters correctly identified at the specified distance. Twelve monthly BCVA values were averaged [(Month1+Month2+...+Month12)/12], and the baseline BCVA value was subtracted from the average. A positive change value indicates an improvement in visual acuity, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Monthly from Month 1 through Month 12
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). Missing values imputed by the mean value last observation carried forward (MV-LOCF).

group.title: Ranibizumab (RFB002)
group.description: 3 initial intravitreal injections to the study eye at Day 1, Month 1 and Month 2, followed by as-needed intravitreal injections of ranibizumab 0.5 mg guided by VA stabilization, plus sham laser

group.title: Laser
group.description: Laser photocoagulation applied to the study eye at Day 1, followed by active laser photocoagulation at intervals no shorter than 3 months apart, plus sham injections

measure.title: Mean Average Change From Baseline in Best-Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) (Letters) to Month 1 Through 12
measure.description: Visual acuity with eyeglasses was assessed in a sitting position using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at an initial testing distance of 4 meters. A letter score was calculated based on the number of letters correctly identified at the specified distance. Twelve monthly BCVA values were averaged [(Month1+Month2+...+Month12)/12], and the baseline BCVA value was subtracted from the average. A positive change value indicates an improvement in visual acuity, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). Missing values imputed by the mean value last observation carried forward (MV-LOCF).

analysis.method_desc: One-sided p-value for treatment difference is derived from the two-sided stratified Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel test using the row means score statistics.
analysis.estimate_desc: Estimated from ANOVA (stratified) model. Stratified analysis includes DME type (focal, diffuse, honeycomb and petaloid) and Baseline BCVA(≤ 60 letters and > 60 letters) as factors.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in BCVA (Letters) at Each Visit
outcome.description: Visual acuity with eyeglasses was assessed in a sitting position using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS)-like charts at an initial testing distance of 4 meters. A letter score was calculated based on the number of letters correctly identified at the specified distance. A positive change value indicates an improvement in visual acuity, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Monthly from Month 1 through Month 12
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) with missing values imputed by the last observation carried forward (LOCF). The number analyzed is the number of patients with a value for both baseline and the specific post-baseline visit.

outcome.description: Visual functioning was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in visual functioning, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, observed data (no missing data imputations). The number analyzed is the number of patients with a value for both baseline and the specific post-baseline visit.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Color Vision at Month 6 and Month 12
outcome.description: Color vision was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in color vision, while a negative change value indicates a worsening.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, observed data (no missing data imputations).The number analyzed is the number of patients with a value for both baseline and the specific post-baseline visit.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Driving at Month 6 and Month 12
outcome.description: Driving was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in driving, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. Note: Many patients did not answer the driving related question as they did not drive at all.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set, observed data (no missing data imputations).The number analyzed is the number of patients with a value for both baseline and the specific post-baseline visit.

group.title: Ranibizumab (RFB002)
group.description: 3 initial intravitreal injections to the study eye at Day 1, Month 1 and Month 2, followed by as-needed intravitreal injections of ranibizumab 0.5 mg guided by VA stabilization, plus sham laser

group.title: Laser
group.description: Laser photocoagulation applied to the study eye at Day 1, followed by active laser photocoagulation at intervals no shorter than 3 months apart, plus sham injections

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient-Reported Driving at Month 6 and Month 12
measure.description: Driving was assessed by the patient using the National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25) on a scale from 0 to 100, where 0 = worst possible score and 100 = best. A positive change value indicates a perceived improvement in driving, while a negative change value indicates a worsening. Note: Many patients did not answer the driving related question as they did not drive at all.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set, observed data (no missing data imputations).The number analyzed is the number of patients with a value for both baseline and the specific post-baseline visit.

outcome.title: Mean Number of Ranibizumab Re-treatments Received in the Study Eye From Month 3 Onward
outcome.description: A ranibizumab re-treatment was defined as an administration of ranibizumab injection at a scheduled visit following at least one non-missed visit where ranibizumab was not administered in the study eye due to visual acuity stabilization. This outcome measure was pre-specified for the Ranibizumab 0.5 mg arm only.
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set

group.title: Ranibizumab (RFB002)
group.description: 3 initial intravitreal injections to the study eye at Day 1, Month 1 and Month 2, followed by as-needed intravitreal injections of ranibizumab 0.5 mg guided by VA stabilization, plus sham laser

measure.title: Mean Number of Ranibizumab Re-treatments Received in the Study Eye From Month 3 Onward
measure.description: A ranibizumab re-treatment was defined as an administration of ranibizumab injection at a scheduled visit following at least one non-missed visit where ranibizumab was not administered in the study eye due to visual acuity stabilization. This outcome measure was pre-specified for the Ranibizumab 0.5 mg arm only.
measure.population: Safety Analysis Set

reported_events.time_frame: Day 1 through study completion, an average of 1 year

group.title: Ranibizumab (RFB002)
group.description: 3 initial intravitreal injections to the study eye at Day 1, Month 1 and Month 2, followed by as-needed intravitreal injections of ranibizumab 0.5 mg guided by VA stabilization, plus sham laser

group.title: Laser
group.description: Laser photocoagulation applied to the study eye at Day 1, followed by active laser photocoagulation at intervals no shorter than 3 months apart, plus sham injections

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (ie, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
